post_text:
Good morning, Gerber Families!
We hope you all are safe and well. With everything going on these days, pandemic, wild fires, political and social media influences, it is important to build and strengthen healthy relationships with your children and other family members. Here is a wonderful resource on 5 fun art activities that promote social, emotional learning and well-being. Please take a few moments and review this resource for some great and fun ideas!

https://betterkids.education/blog/5-art-activities-for-social-emotional-learning

shared_text:
Gloria Mu√±oz
June 3 at 12:13 PM ¬∑

Thank you so much Gerber Union Elementary School staff and teachers for this parade. I know it meant a lot to the students and their families. I am proud to say that I graduated from Gerber School (2012). Today I saw some of my teachers and brought back memories of when I attended Gerber School and felt as if this parade was also for me. It was an amazing experience and thank you staff and teachers for finding a way to educate our children in difficult times and providing them with lunches. On behalf of myself and my family. Thank you for everything!!

(Disclaimer: I don‚Äôt own the rights to the music)

ATTENTION Parents & Students...
Gerber staff will be doing a parade through the town tomorrow to say a final goodbye and happy summer to you all. We will leave the school at 11:00am and follow the map attached. If you do not live on the route we are taking and would like to join us, the locations listed below would be great to park your car. In Proberta

When you feel like your day may be unraveling or you've been a bit hard on yourself for whatever reason, giving yourself grace is important. It's about giving yourself that kindness you often deserve. Sounds awesome, right?!. Here is a great resource on self-grace from WhyTry's Parent's Guide to Resilience.

https://resilienceguide.org/pg-self-grace/

http://info.apertureed.com/sel-at-home?utm_campaign=COVID-19&utm_source=hs_email&utm_medium=email&utm_content=87443454&_hsenc=p2ANqtz-_WDDulOik_dUA01rwGYhGTCZAjxDHEde5LsZPdN8h5B1bHMsJv8ehp-2Jns5_GtMzJkK0c5kNWBx59EyIteIatO07XIw&_hsmi=87443287
shared_text:
Aperture Education: SEL at Home
Promoting SEL at Home is a series of developmentally appropriate social and emotional learning (SEL) resources for parents, families, and caregivers to use at home. These lesson ideas facilitate the development of SEL skills in children, from infancy through high school.

post_text:
Parents/Guardians: Gerber School will be checking out chromebooks to students that need a device for online learning. If you are interested in borrowing a chromebook from the school, please click on the link below and fill in the requested information. This form must be completed prior to check out. Come to the school during your scheduled time and staff will be there to assist you through the checkout system. Student must be present to checkout a chromebook.

Link to form (fill this out before coming to check out your chromebook): https://bit.ly/34qdigc

Checkout times:
Wednesday, April 8th:
10:45-11:30 Grades 1 & 2 and TK/K parents if needed
11:30-12:15 Grade 3
12:15-1:00 Grade 4

Thursday, April 9th
10:45-11:30 Grade 5
11:30-12:15 Grade 6
12:15-1:00 Grade 7
1:00-1:45 Grade 8

Please check the school website later for more information.

post_text: Gerber School will be offering free meals to all children ages 0-18 while school remains closed due to COVID-19 safety concerns. Meals will be offered Monday-Friday from 11:00am-12:00pm at three locations: Gerber School, Gerber Park and across the street from the Post Office in Proberta. Meal delivery starts Tuesday, March 17th and will run through Friday, March 27th.

shared_text:
University of Montana
January 10 at 2:16 PM ¬∑

Recent UM business graduate Dante Olson just won the Buck Buchanan Award, given to the most outstanding defensive football player in the nation. But he is so much more than a force on the field. Olson also was a finalist for the Campbell Trophy, college football's most prestigious academic award. We are proud to call him a Griz!

post_text: Gerber School is proud to recognize Jesse Johnson, Mr. Jesse, as our December Employee of the Month. Mr. Jesse is our Head of Maintenance, Operations, and Transportation, but he wears so many other hats that it's hard to keep up with him. We appreciate everything that he does for Gerber School, staff, parents, and especially kids...and always with a smile on his face! THANK YOU, Mr. Jesse!!! üôÇ
